title: Business Finance
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts in corporate finance. Topics include discounted cash flow, capital budgeting, bond and stock valuation, portfolio theory, market efficiency, the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM), the determinants of capital structure and options. We will seek a balance between theoretical paradigms, the empirical facts, and their applicability to real-world issues. Emphasis will be placed on general principles and problem solving. Students will not receive credit for both MGT 180 and MGT 180R. Prerequisites: ECE 109 or ECON 100A or ECON 120A or MAE 108 or MATH 180A or MATH 183 or MATH 186.
